intro: Heteropterys actinoctenia, commonly known as the star-leaved huito, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
